name_th: พระบรมมหาราชวัง
description: The magnificent Grand Palace has been the official residence of Thai Kings since 1782. Home to the sacred Emerald Buddha (Phra Kaew Morakot), this sprawling complex showcases the pinnacle of Thai architecture and craftsmanship.
highlights: Emerald Buddha,Golden Stupas,Chakri Maha Prasat,Royal Architecture
notes: Strict dress code: no shorts, sleeveless tops, or revealing clothing. Rent appropriate attire at entrance if needed.

name_th: วัดโพธิ์
description: Home to the famous 46-meter-long Reclining Buddha covered in gold leaf. Wat Pho is also Thailand's first university and the birthplace of traditional Thai massage.
highlights: Reclining Buddha,Chedis,Thai Massage School,Traditional Medicine Museum
notes: Thai massage school on-site offers authentic traditional massage services

name_th: วัดอรุณราชวรารามราชวรมหาวิหาร
description: Iconic riverside temple known for its stunning Khmer-style central prang (tower) decorated with colorful porcelain. Particularly beautiful at sunset when viewed from across the Chao Phraya River.
notes: Climb the steep stairs for panoramic river views. Cross-river ferry from Wat Pho pier

name_th: ตลาดนัดจตุจักร
description: One of the world's largest weekend markets with over 15,000 stalls selling everything from clothing and antiques to plants and pets. A true Bangkok shopping experience.
notes: Open Saturday-Sunday only. Bring cash, wear comfortable shoes, stay hydrated

name_th: บ้านจิม ทอมป์สัน
description: Beautiful traditional Thai teak house museum showcasing Southeast Asian art collection. Former home of American businessman Jim Thompson who helped revive Thai silk industry.
highlights: Traditional Thai Architecture,Art Collection,Thai Silk,Tropical Gardens
notes: Mandatory guided tour included in admission. Air-conditioned cafe on-site

name_th: เอเชียทีค เดอะ ริเวอร์ฟร้อนท์
description: Riverside night market and entertainment complex with over 1,500 boutiques and 40 restaurants. Features a large Ferris wheel offering panoramic city views.
notes: Free shuttle boat from Saphan Taksin BTS station

name_th: ถนนข้าวสาร
description: Famous backpacker street lined with budget accommodations, bars, street food stalls, and shops. The heart of Bangkok's backpacker scene since the 1980s.
notes: Very crowded at night, watch belongings. Wide range of street food available

name_th: สวนลุมพินี
description: Bangkok's largest public park offering a green oasis in the heart of the city. Popular for jogging, tai chi, paddle boating, and monitor lizard spotting.
notes: Free outdoor aerobics classes at 18:00. Watch for monitor lizards near the lake

name_th: ไอคอนสยาม
description: Mega luxury shopping complex on the Chao Phraya River featuring high-end brands, SookSiam indoor floating market, and stunning river views.
highlights: Luxury Shopping,Indoor Floating Market,River Views,Apple Store,Takashimaya
notes: Free shuttle boat from Saphan Taksin BTS. SookSiam showcases Thai regional culture

name_th: หอศิลปวัฒนธรรมแห่งกรุงเทพมหานคร
description: Contemporary art museum featuring rotating exhibitions of Thai and international artists. Free admission with multiple floors of galleries.
notes: Free admission. Located at National Stadium BTS. Cafe on top floor

name_th: ศาลพระพรหม
description: Famous Hindu shrine featuring a four-faced Brahma statue. Busy worship site attracting locals and tourists seeking blessings and good fortune.
notes: Traditional Thai dancers perform when devotees fulfill vows. Located at busy Ratchaprasong intersection

name_th: เยาวราช
description: Bangkok's vibrant Chinatown famous for incredible street food, gold shops, temples, and traditional Chinese medicine stores. Comes alive at night with food stalls.
highlights: Street Food,Gold Shops,Wat Traimit,Chinese Temples,Night Market
notes: Best street food in Bangkok. Try at T&K Seafood, Nai Mong Hoi Tod. Very crowded weekends

name_th: จ๊อดแฟร์ส พระราม9
description: Modern night market featuring diverse street food, shopping, and entertainment. Instagram-worthy atmosphere with colorful lights and photo spots.
notes: Multiple locations. Also at DanNeramit. Modern alternative to traditional night markets

name_th: ซีไลฟ์ แบงค็อก โอเชี่ยนเวิลด์
description: Southeast Asia's largest aquarium located beneath Siam Paragon. Features ocean tunnel, shark feeding shows, and diverse marine life.
highlights: Ocean Tunnel,Shark Feeding,Penguins,Interactive Exhibits,Glass Bottom Boat
notes: Book online for discounts. Combined tickets with Madame Tussauds available

name_th: เทอร์มินอล 21
description: Themed shopping mall with each floor representing a different city (Tokyo, London, Istanbul, etc.). Popular for mid-range shopping and diverse food court.
notes: Famous Pier 21 food court on 5th floor with excellent budget Thai food. Connected to Asok BTS

name_th: มหานคร สกายวอล์ค
description: Thailand's highest observation deck at 314 meters on top of King Power Mahanakhon building. Features thrilling glass floor and 360-degree city views.
highlights: Glass Floor,360 Views,Rooftop Bar,Sunset Views,City Skyline
notes: Book sunset slots early. Mahanakhon SkyBar on 78th floor. BTS Chong Nonsi

name_th: ตลาดนัดรถไฟ ศรีนครินทร์
description: Vintage-themed night market featuring retro items, antiques, clothing, and excellent street food. Known for nostalgic Thai railway theme and collectibles.
notes: Open Thursday-Sunday. Free parking. Great for vintage fashion and collectibles

name_th: สยามนิรมิต
description: Spectacular cultural show featuring Thai history, traditions, and festivals. Includes traditional village, dinner buffet, and world-class stage production.
notes: Book in advance. Optional Thai buffet dinner from 18:00. Show at 20:00. Free round-trip transfer from hotels

name_th: บางกระเจ้า
description: A large green area in the bend of Chao Phraya River offering cycling paths, floating markets, and Sri Nakhon Khuean Khan Park. Escape from city pollution.
notes: Access via cross-river ferry from Klong Toei or Wat Klong Toei Nok. Rent bikes at pier. Visit weekend floating market

name_th: name_th
description: description
notes: notes

name_th: วัดพระธาตุดอยสุเทพ
description: Chiang Mai's most iconic temple perched atop Doi Suthep mountain, offering breathtaking panoramic city views and housing a sacred Buddha relic. Visitors can climb 309 steps or take a cable car.
notes: Dress code: shoulders and knees covered. Cable car available for 50 THB.

name_th: อุทยานแห่งชาติดอยอินทนนท์
description: Thailand's highest peak (2,565m) featuring the Royal Twin Pagodas, stunning waterfalls including Wachirathan, hiking trails like Kew Mae Pan, and cool climate year-round.
highlights: Highest Peak,Twin Pagodas,Waterfalls,Kew Mae Pan Trail,Cool Climate
notes: Entrance fee 300 THB for foreigners. Bring warm clothing as it can be cold at the peak.

name_th: อุทยานธรรมชาติช้าง
description: Ethical elephant sanctuary focused on rescue and rehabilitation. Visitors can observe elephants in their natural environment, feed them, and learn about conservation without riding or tricks.
highlights: Elephant Encounters,No Riding,Rescue Stories,Mud Bath,River Time
notes: Booking required in advance. Price includes transportation from Chiang Mai, lunch, guide.

name_th: วัดเจดีย์หลวง
description: 14th-century temple in the Old City featuring an impressive partially-ruined chedi (stupa) and excellent example of Lanna architecture. Once housed the Emerald Buddha.
notes: Monk Chat available daily 09:00-18:00 to learn about Buddhism and Thai culture.

name_th: ตลาดถนนคนเดินวันอาทิตย์
description: Famous weekly market stretching along Rachadamnoen Road in the Old City. Paradise for shoppers and food lovers with handmade crafts, textiles, souvenirs, and amazing street food.
notes: Open Sunday only. Bring cash, wear comfortable shoes. Very crowded but amazing atmosphere.

name_th: ไนท์บาซาร์เชียงใหม่
description: Iconic nightly market along Chang Klan Road featuring hundreds of stalls selling crafts, clothing, jewelry, and delicious local dishes like Khao Soi. Entertainment and massage parlors nearby.
notes: Open daily. Great for souvenirs and local food. Bargaining expected.

name_th: น้ำตกบัวต
nature,waterfall,adventure
latitude: Unique limestone waterfalls where the grippy rocks allow visitors to climb directly up the cascading water. Natural and fun experience away from tourist crowds.
rating: 60km from city center. Entrance 300 THB for foreigners. Wear swimsuit, bring towel.

name_th: แกรนด์แคนยอนเชียงใหม่
description: Former limestone quarry transformed into adventure water park. Offers swimming, cliff jumping (5-10m), zip-lining, kayaking, and inflatable obstacle course.
notes: Life jackets mandatory and included. Food and drinks available. Popular with young travelers.

name_th: โรงเรียนสอนทำอาหาร
description: Highly-rated cooking school offering hands-on classes to learn authentic Thai cuisine. Includes market visit, farm tour, and cooking 5-7 dishes to take home the recipes.
highlights: Market Visit,Organic Farm,Hands-on Cooking,Recipe Book,Lunch Included
notes: Booking required. Price includes transport, ingredients, recipes. Vegetarian options available.

name_th: วัดพระสิงห์
description: One of Chiang Mai's most venerated temples featuring classic Lanna architecture and housing the revered Phra Singh Buddha statue. Beautiful murals and intricate wood carvings.
notes: Active Buddhist temple. Respectful dress required.

name_th: นิมมานเหมินท์
description: Hip and trendy area popular with digital nomads, students, and tourists. Features cool cafes, boutique shops, art galleries, coworking spaces, and vibrant nightlife.
notes: Popular area for Instagram-worthy cafes. MAYA Lifestyle Shopping Center is the main mall.

name_th: เส้นทางพระ
name_en: Monk's Trail to Wat Pha Lat
description: Serene jungle hiking trail (2-3km) leading to the hidden temple of Wat Pha Lat. Continues up to Doi Suthep. Beautiful forest setting with streams and statues along the way.
highlights: Jungle Hike,Hidden Temple,Peaceful,Photo Spots,Continue to Doi Suthep
notes: Free entry. Wear proper hiking shoes. From Wat Pha  Lat, can continue 2.5km up to Doi Suthep.

name_th: ตลาดวโรรส
description: Authentic local market providing a true taste of Northern Thai life. Wide variety of fresh produce, flowers, Northern Thai snacks, and handicrafts. Less touristy than night markets.
notes: Open daily. Great for authentic local food and shopping. Much cheaper than tourist markets.

name_th: เดินป่า
description: Multi-day or day trekking adventures through lush jungles visiting Karen and Lahu hill tribe villages. Includes bamboo rafting, waterfall visits, and cultural homestays.
data_source: Prices vary by operator and duration. Book with reputable companies. Fitness level required.

name_th: ตลาดนัดเปลื้องเรือดี
description: Lively night market with great atmosphere, diverse street food, shopping, and entertainment including live dance shows. Popular with locals and tourists.
notes: Open Tuesday-Sunday. Great food variety. Live entertainment on weekends.

name_th: วัดเชียงมั่น
description: Chiang Mai's oldest temple founded in 1297. Houses important Buddha images including Phra Sila and crystal Buddha Sae Tang Khamani. Beautiful elephant-supported chedi.
notes: Free for Thais, 20 THB for foreigners. Quieter than other major temples.

name_th: ล่องฟ้า
description: Thrilling zipline adventure through lush rainforest canopy. Over 30 platforms, longest zipline 800m. Professional guides, safety equipment, and hotel transfers included.
notes: Booking required. Min age 4, max weight 125kg. Hotel pickup included. Very professional operation.

name_th: คลองแม่ข่า
description: Recently revitalized historic canal running through Old City. Picturesque walking path with renovated areas, local cafes, temples, and glimpses of authentic Chiang Mai life.
notes: Free. Nice for leisurely walks. Several hip cafes along the canal. Great for photography.

name_th: name_th
description: description
notes: notes

name_th: หาดป่าตอง
description: Phuket's most famous beach and entertainment hub. White sand beach with water sports by day, transforms into vibrant nightlife center with beach clubs, bars, and legendary Bangla Road at night.
notes: Very crowded. Watch belongings. Great for nightlife. Beach chairs 100-200 THB/day.

name_th: หาดกะตะ
description: Popular family-friendly beach with calm waters, golden sand, and scenic views. Excellent for swimming, snorkeling, and surfing during monsoon season. Less crowded than Patong.
notes: Two beaches: Kata and Kata Noi. Kata Noi quieter. Good surf May-October.

name_th: หาดกะรน
description: Long stretch of golden sand (3km) ideal for sunbathing, swimming, and  relaxed beach walks. Family-friendly atmosphere with fewer crowds than Patong. Beautiful sunsets.
notes: Quieter than Patong but still good facilities. Great for long beach walks.

name_th: ฟรีด อมบีช
description: Pristine hidden beach accessible only by boat or jungle hike. Bright white sand, crystal-clear emerald water, minimal development. Paradise away from crowds.
notes: Access: boat from Patong (200 THB) or 30-min jungle hike. Entrance fee 200 THB.

name_th: หาดในหาน
description: Picturesque crescent bay at Phuket's southern tip with crystal-clear turquoise waters. Popular with locals, less touristic. Backed by lake and monastery.
notes: Popular with expats and locals. Rougher water May-October. Great restaurants nearby.

name_th: หมู่เกาะพีพี
description: Breathtaking limestone islands with crystal-clear waters and vibrant marine life. Maya Bay (The Beach movie location) has been beautifully restored. Perfect for snorkeling, diving, and island hopping.
notes: Day tours from Phuket 1,000-2,500 THB. Maya Bay entry 400 THB. Book early for speedboat tours.

name_th: พระพุทธมิ่งมงคลเอกก นาคคีรี
description: Iconic 45-meter marble Buddha statue atop Nakkerd Hill (400m) offering breathtaking 360° panoramic views of Phuket. Free entry, spiritual atmosphere, and stunning photo opportunities.
notes: Free but donations welcome for construction. Dress respectfully. Amazing views of island.

name_th: เมืองเก่าภูเก็ต
description: Charming historic district with colorful Sino-Portuguese buildings, quaint cafes, art galleries, and boutique shops. Sunday Walking Street market draws huge crowds.
best_time_to_visit: Sunday for market | Weekday mornings quieter
notes: Sunday Walking Street 16:00-22:00 on Thalang Road. Great for Instagram photos.

name_th: เกาะเขาพิงกัน
description: Iconic limestone karst island made famous by James Bond movie 'The Man with the Golden Gun'. Part of stunning Phang Nga Bay with spectacular sea caves and mangrove forests.
highlights: James Bond Rock,Phang Nga Bay,Sea Caves,Kayaking,Limestone Karsts
notes: Tours from Phuket 1,200-2,000 THB. Entry 300 THB. Very touristy but iconic. Include kayaking in sea caves.

name_th: เขตรักษาพันธุ์ช้าง
description: Ethical elephant sanctuary where rescued elephants roam freely. Observe, feed, and learn about conservation without riding. Beautiful natural setting with mud spa experience for elephants.
notes: Booking required. 3,000 THB includes lunch, guide, transfer. Morning or afternoon sessions.

name_th: วัดฉลอง
description: Phuket's most important and largest Buddhist temple. Beautiful architecture, important religious significance, and peaceful ambiance. Home to statues of revered monks.
notes: Free entry. Dress code: cover shoulders/knees. Most beautiful temple complex in Phuket.

name_th: ตลาดนัดสุดสัปดาห์
description: Huge local market offering incredible variety of street food, clothing, handicrafts, and souvenirs. Authentic local atmosphere, less touristy than Patong markets.
notes: Saturday-Sunday only. Great authentic food. Much cheaper than tourist areas. Very local.

name_th: อันดามันดา วอเตอร์พาร์ค
description: Thailand's first world-class waterpark with thrilling slides, wave pools, lazy river, and family zones. Thai-themed design with various zones for all ages.
notes: Tickets 1,390 THB. Book online for discounts. Lockers extra. Food inside pricey, can bring snacks.

name_th: แหลมพรหมเทพ
description: Phuket's most famous sunset viewpoint at the southern tip. Breathtaking panoramic views of Andaman Sea, nearby islands, and spectacular sunsets. Lighthouse and elephant shrine.
notes: Free. Very crowded at sunset. Arrive 30-45 mins early for parking and good spot.

name_th: ถนนบางลา
description: Legendary nightlife street in Patong. Hundreds of bars, clubs, go-go bars, live music, and street performances. Vibrant atmosphere from dusk till dawn.
notes: Pedestrian only 18:00+. Watch belongings. Drink prices higher than normal. Very touristy.

name_th: หาดสุรินทร์
description: Chic and trendy beach with upscale vibe. Raw natural beauty with white sand and clear water. Numerous high-end beach clubs, bars, and restaurants. Popular with jet-setters.
notes: More upscale than other beaches. Beach clubs can be pricey. Rougher seas in monsoon.

name_th: หาดกมลา
description: Peaceful family-friendly beach with laid-back atmosphere. Powdery white sand, clear waters, and authentic fishing village charm. Less developed than major beaches.
notes: Great for families with kids. Authentic local seafood restaurants. Phuket FantaSea show nearby.

name_th: โรงกลั่นเหล้ารัมอ่าวฉลอง
description: Award-winning craft rum distillery offering tours and tastings. Learn about rum production using local sugarcane, see the distillation process, and sample various rum varieties including cocktails.
notes: Tour 300 THB includes 3 tastings and cocktail. High-quality craft rum. Book tour in advance.

name_th: ศิลปะบนถนน
description: Instagram-worthy street art and colorful murals throughout Old Phuket Town. Dozens of art pieces depicting local culture, history, and Sino-Portuguese heritage. Free photo tour.
notes: Free. Combine with Old Town visit. Map available online. Popular Soi Rommanee for best murals.

name_th: โยน่า
description: Unique floating beach club anchored in the Andaman Sea. Relax on floating platforms, sunbathe, swim, and enjoy food and drinks literally in the middle of the ocean. Instagram paradise.
notes: Minimum spend 800 THB. Boat transfer included. Book in advance. Amazing for photos and unique experience.
